comments.body: The specification of this annotation is missing from the proposal document.
I will update the proposal to reflect the latest changes after code review.
Does this let a client request a new NodePort?  If so this needs to be quota protected (like nodePorts) because they are a finite resource and this can allow exhaustion attacks.

This allocates a max f one NodePort per service, but yeah.  Any experts can
point in the right direction?

On Sep 5, 2016 11:58 AM, "Clayton Coleman" notifications@github.com wrote:

> In pkg/api/service/annotations.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/29409#discussion_r77550810
> :
> 
> > @@ -25,4 +32,58 @@ const (
> >     //
> >     // Not all cloud providers support this annotation, though AWS & GCE do.
> >     AnnotationLoadBalancerSourceRangesKey = "service.beta.kubernetes.io/load-balancer-source-ranges"
> > +
> > -   // AnnotationExternalTraffic An annotation that denotes if this Service desires to route external traffic to local
> > -   // endpoints only. This preserves Source IP and avoids a second hop.
> > -   AnnotationExternalTraffic = "service.alpha.kubernetes.io/external-traffic"
> > -   // AnnotationValueExternalTrafficLocal Value of annotation to specify local endpoints behaviour
> > -   AnnotationValueExternalTrafficLocal = "OnlyLocal"
> > -   // AnnotationValueExternalTrafficGlobal Value of annotation to specify global (legacy) behaviour
> > -   AnnotationValueExternalTrafficGlobal = "Global"
> > -   // AnnotationHealthCheckNodePort Annotation specifying the healthcheck nodePort for the service
> > -   // If not specified, annotation is created by the service api backend with the allocated nodePort
> > -   // Will use user-specified nodePort value if specified by the client
> > -   AnnotationHealthCheckNodePort = "service.alpha.kubernetes.io/healthcheck-nodeport"
> 
> Does this let a client request a new NodePort? If so this needs to be
> quota protected (like nodePorts) because they are a finite resource and
> this can allow exhaustion attacks.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/29409/files/b82c028f77d85ac0be39b510ccdbc2783e43fdc7#r77550810,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFVgVLYbJbaO9EXrh0N_L1yuemTvxBblks5qnGZwgaJpZM4JSUXH
> .

k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/quota/evaluator/core/services.go should contain the
calculator.

> > -   // AnnotationValueExternalTrafficLocal Value of annotation to specify local endpoints behaviour
> > -   AnnotationValueExternalTrafficLocal = "OnlyLocal"
> > -   // AnnotationValueExternalTrafficGlobal Value of annotation to specify global (legacy) behaviour
> > -   AnnotationValueExternalTrafficGlobal = "Global"
> > -   // AnnotationHealthCheckNodePort Annotation specifying the healthcheck nodePort for the service
> > -   // If not specified, annotation is created by the service api backend with the allocated nodePort
> > -   // Will use user-specified nodePort value if specified by the client
> > -   AnnotationHealthCheckNodePort = "service.alpha.kubernetes.io/healthcheck-nodeport"
> 
> This allocates a max f one NodePort per service, but yeah. Any experts can
> point in the right direction?

> = "service.alpha.kubernetes.io/external-traffic" > + //
> AnnotationValueExternalTrafficLocal Value of annotation to specify local

> > - // AnnotationValueExternalTrafficGlobal Value of annotation to

@girishkalele - not urgent for Alpha, should handle in beta.  Open a
tracking issue and link it to the feature bug?
